pages.text: The brick casting vessel is a great innovation. Not only does it use better molds, it also can cool things faster than a stone casting vessel! Of course, it does not cool things faster by default, so you will need to set up some infrastructure to do that.
pages.title: Better Casting II

pages.text: The brick casting vessel is crafted in the workbench; use JEI to view the recipe. It takes 2 $(item)iron sheets$(), 2 $(item)bricks$(), and 3 $(item)brick slabs$(). It also requires a hammer of copper or better.
pages.title: Crafting the Vessel

pages.text: To use the vessel, simply right click to place your molds inside. It then functions the similarly as a stone casting vessel. Right click again when there is no metal inside to remove your molds from the vessel. You can still get burned when using a brick casting vessel, so remember to keep in mind the temperature!
pages.title: Use of the Vessel

pages.text: In order to speed up the casting vessel, water must be supplied to it. It does not accept buckets; you must use pipes or a screw pump. Every tick, the casting vessel will use up to 10mB of water to cool the metal inside at a $(o)much$() faster rate. A copper ingot can be cooled in just 2.5 seconds with enough water!
pages.title: Overclocked Cooling
